message.content:
Below is a worked‐through example of how one can arrive at (and build) the pictured shape:

1)  DETAILED ANALYSIS OF THE TARGET IMAGE  
•  Total Block Count: 9 blocks  
   – 1 green block in the very center/top.  
   – 4 blue blocks arranged around that green block (forming a “plus” when viewed from above).  
   – 4 orange wedge‐shaped blocks, each leaning outward against one of the blue blocks.  
•  Layering: Essentially two “levels.”  
   – Top Layer: The green block plus the 4 blue blocks (all their top faces come to the same height).  
   – Below/Outward Layer: The 4 orange wedges slope down from the edges of the blue blocks to the ground.  
•  Spatial Relationships:  
   – The green block sits in the center, touching all four blue blocks.  
   – Each blue block stands upright (top face horizontal) and touches one side of the central green block, forming a cross/plus shape around it.  
   – Each orange wedge is placed against an outer face of one of the blue blocks, slanting outwards to the floor.  

2)  SELECTING THE DICTIONARY BLOCKS  
•  Green Center Block: Must be the green cube in the same orientation as shown in the dictionary → Block index 2.  
•  Four Blue Upright Blocks: All appear as cubes with their top faces horizontal → Block index 1 used four times (all are the same orientation).  
•  Four Orange “Lean‐Out” Wedges: In the dictionary, the orange wedges #13, #14, #15, and #16 are each the same basic wedge but oriented differently. To get one wedge leaning out on each of the four sides (front/back/left/right) without rotating them yourself, you need one of each index.  

Hence, the required blocks are:  
•  (1) Green:    index 2  
•  (4) Blue:     index 1 (repeated four times)  
•  (4) Orange:   indexes 13, 14, 15, and 16 (one each)  

3)  ASSEMBLY ORDER (EXAMPLE)  
A straightforward way is to place the four blue columns to form a plus, add the green top, and then attach wedges around the outside.  In the required JSON‐style format:

{
  Step1: Move block with index 1,
  Step2: Move block with index 1,
  Step3: Move block with index 1,
  Step4: Move block with index 1,
  Step5: Move block with index 2,
  Step6: Move block with index 13,
  Step7: Move block with index 14,
  Step8: Move block with index 15,
  Step9: Move block with index 16
}

This sequence ensures the plus‐shaped top is built first (blue+green), then each orange wedge is added in turn.
